com.energyxxer.commodore

Class CommandUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.energyxxer.commodore.CommandUtils

  • public final class CommandUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Class containing a series of utility methods and constants for common use in commands.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods

      Escapes the given string's quotes and backslashes.

    • Method Detail

      • escape

        public static java.lang.String escape(java.lang.String str)
        Escapes the given string's quotes and backslashes.
        Parameters:
        str - The string to be escaped.
        Returns:
        The escaped string.

      • quoteIfNecessary

        public static java.lang.String quoteIfNecessary(java.lang.String str)
        Escapes and wraps the given string in quotes if not all its characters are allowed by commands in an unquoted string. If all characters are allowed, nothing is changed.
        Parameters:
        str - The string to check and, if needed, quote.
        Returns:
        The given string, quoted, only if it contains a character not allowed in an unquoted string. Otherwise, the returned string is the same as the original.

      • needsQuoting

        public static boolean needsQuoting(java.lang.String str)
        Returns whether this character contains any characters disallowed in unquoted strings.
        Parameters:
        str - The string whose need for quotation is to be tested.
        Returns:
        true if this character contains any characters, disallowed in unquoted strings, false if all characters are allowed in unquoted strings.

      • numberToPlainString

        public static java.lang.String numberToPlainString(double num)
        Converts the given number into its plain string representation. This method differs from Double.toString() on two aspects:
        1. Whole numbers will be displayed without the decimal places.
        2. Scientific notation will not be used for big nor small numbers.
        Parameters:
        num - The number to turn into a plain number string.
        Returns:
        The number, as a plain number string.

      • numberToStringNoScientific

        public static java.lang.String numberToStringNoScientific(double num)
        Converts the given number into its plain string representation. This method differs from Double.toString() in that scientific notation will not be used.
        Parameters:
        num - The number to turn into a non-scientific number string.
        Returns:
        The number, as a non-scientific number string.
